modules.description: This module implements numerical root-finding algorithms for continuous functions of a single variable. It supports methods such as Brent's, bisection, Illinois (Regula Falsi variant), Newton's, and an extended Brent method that handles functions returning scaled values to avoid floating-point overflow or underflow. These functions operate on intervals and user-defined functions mapping floats to floats (or float and derivative pairs for Newton, or float to (float, int) for Brent2), and return approximate root values. Concrete use cases include solving nonlinear equations in scientific computing, engineering simulations, and financial modeling where analytical solutions are not feasible.
